question: With ref. to Q6042, Isha and Fajr times further up North of London are 11 pm and 3 am respectively. The old and the young have a tough time staying up late and getting up early.
answer:
QUESTION
Any suggestions (other than moving out of here)? Can they during the summer, pray Isha? after a defined interval after Maghrib and go to bed, in these higher latitudes?
ANSWER


Share:
Performing the Isha Salaah any time before 11 PM will never be valid
according to all four math-habs.

We have one suggestion, and this applies specifically to the young, old and
weak. They may delay their Isha to until a few minutes before 3 AM (Subh
Saadiq). Then can wait a few minutes and perform Fajr after 3 AM. In this
way they only have to get up once.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Moulana Imraan Vawda
FATWA DEPT.
